newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czech CSOB $62mln loan to Serbia's Elektroprivreda.
newsitem.headline: Czech CSOB $62mln loan to Serbia's Elektroprivreda.

text.p: Czech bank Ceskoslovenska Obchodni Banka a.s. (CSOB) said on Thursday that it would provide a $62 milion credit to Serbian power company Elektroprivreda Srbije (EPS).

The deal is aimed at putting into operation a commercial arrangement signed in April under which the Czech bank will finance Skoda Trading s.r.o. equipment for the Yugoslav thermal power plant Kolubara B.
The credit will be guaranteed by the Czech export guarantee agency EGAP, CSOB said in a statement.
Serbia's Tanjug news agency reported in early July that problems had emerged in the loan talks over old debts EPS owes to Czech engineering group Skoda a.s..
Kolubara B is a 700 MegaWatt power plant and the total cost involved in its upgrading is estimated at $452 million by the year 2000, of which $65 million is needed in 1997.
